title: Please ID this font
content:
Please can u help me identifying this font. Ive tried the others websites but no luck.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202908im_/http:/typophile.com/files/universal_5474.jpg)
author: najlawehbe

comments.content:
I don't think you will find an exact match.  
It looks like someone slanted, chopped, and generally mistreated some grotesque, just for this logo.

A severe case of "cutting edge logo": [http://cuttingedgelogos.tumblr.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202908/http:/cuttingedgelogos.tumblr.com/ "http://cuttingedgelogos.tumblr.com/")  
The better known professional typeface in this style is Cocon ( [http://www.fontshop.com/families/ff-cocon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202908/http:/www.fontshop.com/families/ff-cocon "http://www.fontshop.com/families/ff-cocon")) (others: [http://www.fontshop.com/people/stephen-coles/fontlists/soft-sans-curve-t...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202908/http:/www.fontshop.com/people/stephen-coles/fontlists/soft-sans-curve-to-corner "http://www.fontshop.com/people/stephen-coles/fontlists/soft-sans-curve-to-corner")).  
The most commonly see free font is Harabara (AKA mangled Helvetica Neue).
